biogHist.abstract: Margaret Blackwood graduated from the University of Melbourne with a BSc in 1938 and MSc in 1940. During the Second World War she served with the Women's Auxiliary Australian Air Force and then was granted an ex-service postgraduate scholarship for Cambridge, where she gained a PhD for her work in plant genetics. In 1951 Blackwood returned to Melbourne and was a senior lecturer at the University of Melbourne until 1974. She was then elected a member of the University Council and in 1980 became the first female Deputy Chancellor. She held both these positions until her retirement in 1983. She was appointed as a Member of the British Empire in 1964 for work in botany and was appointed a Dame (Order of the British Empire - Dames Commander) for her services to education in 1980.

chronItem.event: Born daughter of Robert Leslie and Muriel Pearl (n√©e Henry) Blackwood
Senior science mistress at Lowther Hall CEGGS
Senior science mistress at Korowa CEGGS
University of Melbourne demonstrator and Howitt Research Student
Demonstrator and Caroline Kay Research Scholarship Plant Cytology and Genetics at the University of Melbourne
Joined Women's Auxiliary Australian Air Force (WAAAF) at inception as airwoman
Commanding Officer at No 1 WAAAF Training Depot
Officer-in-charge, with rank of Squadran Officer, WAAAF Training
Staff Officer with WAAAF Western Area
Discharged from Women's Auxiliary Australian Air Force with the rank of Wing Officer
Dean of Women, Mildura Branch, Melbourne University
Australian Chairman of the Soroptimist International Association
Carnegie Scholar for Cambridge University in England
Chairman of the Melbourne University Council and Founder Fellow of the Janet Clarke Hall at the University of Melbourne
Member of the Council of the University of Melbourne

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Papers of Dame Margaret Blackwood (1909-1986)

archref.abstract: 3 Notebooks listing crossings in maize, done by Margaret Blackwood and continued by Dr Olive Lawson. They are labled: 1 Maize Field Book I 1951 to 1967 Dr M Blackwood, Botany School, University of Melbourne. Maize Crosses. Made and Ears Collected... 2 Field Book Maize II 1968 to 1974 & continued by O.B. Lawson... 3 Maize Pedigree Book. Dr Blackwood's Maize Planting Book. 1949 [f] ..."Record of Maize kernels (seeds planted each year & the parents they came from." Pasted in 15 July 1959 memo GJCuming to MB soil samp

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Papers of Dame Margaret Blackwood(1909-1986)

archref.abstract: Personal papers, 1936-1986. Correspondence; photographs; diaries; memoribilia; personal files; WAAF papers; Women's Graduate Centenary Committee; Newham College rolls; publications; photograph of unidentified University students, c. 1890's; B.A. degree certificate with seal attached of Ada McKay.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: In the outdoors, Yarra Valley, Vic.

archref.unittitle: In the outdoors, Yarra Valley, Vic.
archref.abstract: Yarra Valley, Vic. C. 1943-09. In the outdoors, the Director WAAAF, Group Officer Clare Stevenson (second from left) and a WAAAF Wing Officer (in dark uniform) conversing with WAAAF officers who conducted a four-day bivouac for a group of WAAAF officer trainees in an area near Launching Place, as part of their training course. Third from the left is Squadron Officer Margaret Blackwood, the officer in charge of the bivouac and on the extreme right is Flight Officer Doris Carter, a staff instructor for the bivouac. On the latter's right is her assistant, Section Officer Helen Palmer.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Wing Officer Margaret Blackwood (at rear); Director WAAAF; Wing Officer Dorothy Hawthorn (front); Wing Officer Mary Rawlins; Wing Officer Gwen Stark

archref.unittitle: Wing Officer Margaret Blackwood (at rear); Director WAAAF; Wing Officer Dorothy Hawthorn (front); Wing Officer Mary Rawlins; Wing Officer Gwen Stark
archref.abstract: Melbourne, Vic. C. 1945-04. Group portrait of four "original" WAAAF officers with the Director WAAAF Group Officer Clare Stevenson after a WAAAF Staff Officers conference at Air Force Headquarters, Victoria Barracks. Left to right: Wing Officer Margaret Blackwood (at rear); Director WAAAF; Wing Officer Dorothy Hawthorn (front); Wing Officer Mary Rawlins; Wing Officer Gwen Stark.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: WAAAF members walking along a country road.

archref.unittitle: WAAAF members walking along a country road.
archref.abstract: WAAAF members walking along a country road. From left, Squadron Officer Margaret Blackwood; Grace Hunter; Group Officer Clare Stevenson (Director of the WAAAF); Patrica Burnard; Doris Carter. LOWER PLENTY, VIC, Physical description: Black & white Summary: LOWER PLENTY, VIC, 1944-07. WAAAF MEMBERS WALKING ALONG A COUNTRY ROAD. FROM LEFT, SQUADRON OFFICER MARGARET BLACKWOOD; GRACE HUNTER; GROUP OFFICER CLARE STEVENSON (DIRECTOR OF THE WAAAF); PATRICA BURNARD; DORIS CARTER.

archref.unittitle: Group portrait of four "original" WAAAF officers with the Director WAAAF Group Officer Clare Stevenson
archref.abstract: Group portrait of four "original" WAAAF officers with the Director WAAAF Group Officer Clare Stevenson after a WAAAF Staff Officers conference at Air Force Headquarters, Victoria Barracks. Left to right: Wing Officer Margaret Blackwood (at rear); Director WAAAF; Wing Officer Dorothy Hawthorn (front); Wing Officer Mary Rawlins; Wing Officer Gwen Stark.
